definitions.definition: To strike; to hit; to knock; to give a blow to.
examples: Solid bodies, if they be very softly percussed , give no sound.
Falling on the roof of the caravan, the hailstones percussed noisily.

definitions.definition: To attempt to divine the location or other quality of something by tapping on (an overlying surface).
examples: The doctor percussed his chest to determine whether he had pneumonia.

definitions.definition: To attempt to divine the location or other quality of (something) by tapping on an overlying surface.
examples: Percussing a patient's spleen is best done while he is on his back.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To strike; to hit; to knock; to give a blow to.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , chiefly medicine ) To attempt to divine the location or other quality of something by tapping on (an overlying surface).
( transitive , chiefly medicine ) To attempt to divine the location or other quality of (something) by tapping on an overlying surface.
